subject: Philosophy
title: The Golden Mean
description: A quick, practical guide to The Golden Mean.

hook.text: Too much courage is recklessness. Too little is cowardice. Aristotle says the sweet spot is in the middle.

buildup.text: The golden mean says every virtue sits between two vices â€” one of excess, one of deficiency.

discovery.text: Generosity lives between wastefulness and stinginess. Honesty between bluntness and deceit.

twist.text: The mean isn't mathematical midpoint. It shifts with context. What's courageous for a soldier differs from a teacher.

climax.text: Finding the mean requires judgment, not a rulebook. That makes virtue an art, not a science.

punchline.text: Virtue isn't extreme. It's perfectly calibrated.

quiz.question: Why isn't the golden mean a fixed mathematical midpoint?
options: It shifts depending on the person and situation
